info.title: Server Threat Detection Policy APIs
info.description: Provides create, read and update functionality for Azure SQL server Threat Detection policies.

get.description: Get the active server Threat Detection operation result.

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure SQL server for which server Threat Detection policy is defined.

parameters.name: securityAlertPolicyName
parameters.description: The name of the Threat Detection security alert policy. Default is the currently value to use.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: The server Threat Detection operation id to retrieve.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the server Threat Detection operation results.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

 * 404 OperationIdNotFound - The operation with Id does not exist.

 * 405 ServerSecurityAlertOperationResultsNotImplemented - Operations on Server Threat Detection security alert operation results are not enabled yet

 * 500 GetServerSecurityAlertOperationResultsFailed - Failed to get Threat Detection security Alert operation results

get.description: Get a Threat Detection policy associated with an Azure SQL server.

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure SQL server for which server Threat Detection policy is defined.

parameters.name: securityAlertPolicyName
parameters.description: The name of the Threat Detection policy. Default is the currently value to use.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the server Threat Detection policy.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 InvalidServerSecurityAlertPolicyCreateRequest - The create server Threat Detection security alert policy request does not exist or has no properties object.

 * 400 DataSecurityInvalidUserSuppliedParameter - An invalid parameter value was provided by the client.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

 * 500 GetServerSecurityAlertPolicyFailed - Failed to get Threat Detection settings * 500 DatabaseIsUnavailable - Your settings are currently unavailable, please try again later

put.description: Creates or updates a Threat Detection policy for an Azure SQL server.

parameters.name: serverName
parameters.description: The name of the Azure SQL server for which server Threat Detection policy will be defined.

parameters.name: securityAlertPolicyName
parameters.description: The name of the Threat Detection policy. Default is the currently value to use.

202.description: Successfully set the server Threat Detection policy.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 InvalidServerSecurityAlertPolicyCreateRequest - The create server Threat Detection security alert policy request does not exist or has no properties object.

 * 400 DataSecurityInvalidUserSuppliedParameter - An invalid parameter value was provided by the client.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

 * 500 UpsertServerSecurityAlertPolicyFailed - An error has occurred while saving Threat detection settings, please try again later * 500 DatabaseIsUnavailable - Your settings are currently unavailable, please try again later

location.description: The location the resource resides in

kind.description: The attributes of the entity that drives portal UI

tags.description: the tags assigned to the resource

ServerSecurityAlertPolicyResourcePropert.description: Properties for an Azure SQL Server Threat Detection policy.

state.description: Specifies the state of the policy. Options are Enabled or Disabled.

disabledAlerts.description: Specifies the comma-separated list of alerts that are disabled. The possible values are:  Sql_Injection, Sql_Injection_Vulnerability, Access_Anomaly, Usage_Anomaly or empty string

emailAddresses.description: Specifies the semicolon-separated list of e-mail addresses to which the alert is sent.

emailAccountAdmins.description: Specifies that the alert is sent to the account administrators. Options are Enabled or Disabled.

storageEndpoint.description: Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). This blob storage will hold all Threat Detection audit logs.

storageAccountAccessKey.description: Specifies the identifier key of the Threat Detection audit storage account.

retentionDays.description: Specifies the number of days to keep in the Threat Detection audit logs.
